posts.name:
Jeff Roberts
Jeff Roberts
posts.content:
Could AI be the key to rethinking how your organization drives innovation and long-term growth?

A recent Wired article highlights how businesses are evolving their approach to AI, integrating it into broader organizational strategies rather than treating it as a standalone tool. This approach signals a shift in mindset‚Äîviewing AI not just as a tool for efficiency but as a catalyst for innovation and sustained growth.

What's particularly noteworthy is the emphasis on leadership. For AI to succeed as a strategic partner, leaders must align its implementation with their organization's culture and objectives. It's not just about having the tech; it's about fostering collaboration, improving processes, and driving results that truly matter.

What steps is your organization taking to integrate AI into its long-term vision?

Read more on Wired:

comments.commentText: AI as a strategic partner can transform innovation and long-term growth. The focus on aligning AI with organizational goals feels like the right way to unlock its full potential.

posts.commentAdded: Great insights! Integrating AI into organizational strategies is crucial. Leadership alignment is key to unlocking its full potential for innovation!

posts.name:
Blessing Ikpia
Blessing Ikpia
posts.content:
Dear Young/Aspiring professional, You are too broke to be SHY 

You are too inexperienced to be this quiet

Scared of sending a cold DM.
Scared of hearing "no."
Scared of them not responding (I think this hurts the most )

But here‚Äôs the truth:
The opportunity you‚Äôre praying for is sitting in someone‚Äôs inbox.

What if:

You sent that message to the CEO you admire.

You pitched your skills to that hiring manager.

You reached out to that Marketer asking for an internship or mentorship.

What if you made that post today?

What‚Äôs the worst that could happen?

They ignore you? So what? You‚Äôre no worse off than you are now.

But what if they say yes?

The 'yes' that could give you the experience you need.

The 'yes' that could transform your portfolio.

The 'yes' that could lead to your first remote job in dollars.

Personally, I wish someone told me this earlier in my professional journey.

Most professionals want to help.

They‚Äôve been where you are, and they know what it feels like to start with nothing.

But if you‚Äôre too scared to ask, you‚Äôll never know.

So today, draft a message. SEND IT NOW. Don‚Äôt overthink it.

It could change everything.
Your breakthrough is one DM away.

Tag someone you‚Äôve been too scared to message or share this to encourage a friend who needs it. I'm your
and I'm passionate about seeing you become better.

I'm, follow for more

comments.commentText:
And if you're scared of getting no engagement after making the post, send it to me

I'll like, comment and repost 

I've taken it upon myself, that on this blue app, we must GROW together

And if you're scared about 'not being qualified enough' for a job 

Don't ever forget this  

You can LEARN on the job

I'm willing to guide (if it's a marketing role)

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely loved this message! Taking that leap of faith can lead to incredible opportunities. Let‚Äôs not let fear hold us back! üöÄ #Networking

By the time you're looking at monthly numbers, you're reading history, not shaping the future.

Weekly check-ins aren't micromanagement - they're smart leadership. They let you spot issues while there's still time to fix them.

Stop managing the past. Start influencing the future.

 What's your review frequency?

posts.content:
The hard truths you need to hear about scaling your business.

Scaling your business will be harder, take longer, and be more demanding than you think. Success comes from embracing the challenges, pushing through setbacks, and building a business that endures.

Are you ready to rise to the challenge?

comments.commentText: The hard truth. And why everyone isn't doing it. So when you do the hard work you stand out! Thanks for the reality check!
Holly I was thinking the same thing. I have a lot of admiration for those who successfully scale their businesses. But as you point out, the desire has to be there too!
This is so very true. Scaling is hard but can be much more profitable. By engaging the right partners, it can be a little less daunting.

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely! Resilience and determination are key. Embracing challenges is what truly shapes successful leaders and enduring businesses. üí™‚ú®

posts.name:
Florin Tatulea
Florin Tatulea
posts.content:
I‚Äôve spent a decade now building pipe gen programs at 4 orgs. 

Here‚Äôs one thing that is CRUCIAL to making sure these programs work (most orgs aren‚Äôt putting enough effort here).

Data Quality / Hygiene.

Here‚Äôs the important buckets that you should consider:

 CRM HYGIENE
[ ] Enforce SLAs
[ ] Log prospect calls
[ ] Standardize data fields
[ ] Merge duplicate records
[ ] Summarize meeting notes
[ ] Track deal stage progression
[ ] Rigorously add buying committees to opps
[ ] Maintain accurate funnel/attribution tracking
[ ] Populate historical win/loss data and reasons
[ ] Pipeline, ARR, expansion data (e.g., conversion rates)

 SIGNAL CAPTURE (person-level)
[ ] Product activity
[ ] Social interactions
[ ] Job change history
[ ] Community activity
[ ] Open source activity
[ ] Website visits (person match)
[ ] Support requests (e.g., ticket opened)
[ ] Career progression/achievement unlocked
[ ] Email exchanges (opens, replies, clicks, etc.)
[ ] Marketing engagement (webinars, events, etc.)

 SIGNAL CAPTURE (account-level)
[ ] Fundraising events
[ ] Regional expansion
[ ] Tech stack changes
[ ] Acquisitions/mergers
[ ] Web visits (account match)
[ ] Product reviews/user feedback
[ ] Strategic priorities (via 10Ks etc.)
[ ] Product launch/newsworthy event
[ ] Keyword intent/content consumption
[ ] Hiring trends, open roles, headcount growth

 ENRICHMENT (person-level)
[ ] Role
[ ] Name
[ ] Job title
[ ] Team size
[ ] Seniority level
[ ] Phone number
[ ] Email address
[ ] Follower count
[ ] Community membership
[ ] Professional achievements

 ENRICHMENT (account-level)
[ ] Industry
[ ] Location
[ ] Tech stack
[ ] Competitors
[ ] Web domain
[ ] Annual revenue
[ ] Employee count
[ ] Web traffic (Alexa rank)
[ ] Capital raised/investors
[ ] Business model (e.g., SaaS)

Shoutout tofor putting this together and making sure that our teams have the data they need to execute.

Now once you have this data in one place, you can work with AI tools to build significantly better:

1. Account POVs
2. Lead Scoring for Prioritization
3. Various ‚ÄúPlays‚Äù
4. Distribution of leads
5. Reporting to optimize for what is working

This is a large portion of the outbound game.

comments.commentText: solid framework‚Äîthis is how you make your pipeline really work!

posts.commentAdded: This is invaluable! Strong data hygiene truly underpins successful pipe gen programs. Excited to see how AI can enhance these insights!

posts.name:
Business Development - The Missing Link Between Marketing & Sales - 540,000 Members Strong
Business Development - The Missing Link Between Marketing & Sales - 540,000 Members Strong
posts.content:
You can‚Äôt accurately prescribe sales enablement support if you aren‚Äôt first measuring these sales KPIs.


KPI monitoring is your diagnostic tool.

Below are seven basic sales performance metrics that will provide insight into the health of your sales pipeline and help you identify the obstacles in the sales process that are causing lost or delayed deals.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Lead Conversion Rate

What it measures: The percentage of leads that convert into qualified opportunities.

Why it matters: A low conversion rate from leads to opportunities could indicate issues with lead qualification, the targeting of the right audience, or the initial engagement process.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Sales Qualified Leads (SQLs) vs. Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLs)

What it measures: The ratio of SQLs to MQLs.

Why it matters: If there‚Äôs a disconnect between the marketing team generating leads and the sales team‚Äôs ability to convert them, it may point to a misalignment in lead quality or expectations between the two teams.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Stage-to-Stage Conversion Rate

What it measures: The rate at which opportunities convert from one stage of the sales pipeline to the next (e.g., from qualification to proposal, proposal to negotiation, etc.).

Why it matters: This helps identify specific stages where prospects are dropping off. If opportunities consistently fail to move past a particular stage, it may indicate a need for process improvements, better sales training, or stronger content to overcome objections.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Win Rate

What it measures: The percentage of closed deals compared to the total number of opportunities.

Why it matters: A low win rate could point to problems such as inadequate lead qualification or ineffective sales pitches.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Lead Response Time

What it measures: The average time taken to respond to an marketing generated lead.

Why it matters: Delayed response times can result in lost opportunities to competitors. Faster response times can increase conversion rates significantly.

6Ô∏è‚É£ Pipeline Velocity

What it measures: The speed at which leads move through the pipeline. This is typically calculated as the number of opportunities in the pipeline multiplied by the win rate and divided by the sales cycle length.

Why it matters: Slow pipeline velocity indicates bottlenecks that need to be addressed in either the qualification process or the sales process.

7Ô∏è‚É£ Sales Rep Performance Metrics

What it measures: Metrics like the number of calls made, meetings scheduled, proposals sent, or deals closed by individual sales reps.

Why it matters: Understanding individual performance helps pinpoint areas where certain sales reps might need more training, support, or resources, and can highlight trends that affect overall sales pipeline health.

By regularly tracking these metrics, sales leaders can identify problem areas in the sales pipeline, diagnose the problem and then optimize performance with prescribed sales plays, tools, processes, and/or training.

comments.commentText:
The article below will help you deploy a sales enablement strategy once you understand your KPIs.

https://leadg2.thecenterforsalesstrategy.com/blog/the-4-components-of-sales-enablement

posts.commentAdded: Great insights! Regular KPI monitoring is essential for diagnosing and optimizing sales performance. Lets empower our teams with data-driven strategies! üìäüöÄ

posts.name:
Michael Kainatsky
Michael Kainatsky
posts.content:
The best job I‚Äôve ever had is really shitty. 


I work 7 days a week, sometimes, 24 hours without a break.

The boss was always screaming and complaining.

There was no appreciation whatsoever, now it‚Äôs better.

Working conditions almost always stunk, but improved.

Here‚Äôs a rare picture of me at the office.

I love fatherhood, but most importantly

I really enjoy being a dad.

7k+ diapers changed and counting.

When they‚Äôre done, I will miss this period profoundly.

It‚Äôs cliche and is too often said, but it‚Äôs true.

The time goes fast, don‚Äôt rush it.

Yours truthfully,

comments.commentText:
This takes me down memory lane! I remember when I was single, I used to avoid anything to do with diapers! I‚Äôd even throw up at the sight of one. I was such a clown back then!  

Now, as a mom of two beautiful babies, the journey has truly shaped me. Though I don‚Äôt want to go down that path again for now, some memories still leave me a bit traumatized.

I celebrate you! People like you are rare and special!

posts.commentAdded: Thanks for sharing your journey! It‚Äôs inspiring how the toughest experiences can lead to growth and appreciation of lifes precious moments.

posts.name:
Samantha Russell
Samantha Russell
posts.content:
Wouldn't it be nice if you could open up LinkedIn, or your email in the morning, and have an inbox filled with messages from qualified prospects wanting to work with you?

Here's the thing....

If you truly give away your very best insights... completely for free‚Ä¶

People will line up and ASK YOU to tell them more/teach them more/have you do it for them

Helpful information is like a  magnet... It draws people to you.

It builds trust - because you are proving your trustworthiness and expertise just by continuing to be helpful without asking for anything in return.

The best part? You will naturally attract the the RIGHT people - those already interested in learning more about what you are sharing.

No more cold calls or cold emails - WARM leads come when you do it this way instead.

Yet most business owners just can't fathom that if they truly give away all their best information for FREE - it will lead to new PAYING customers.

But here's the thing...If you share a ton of valuable information with your clients, but nowhere else‚Ä¶

Then your growth strategy is a hope and a prayer that your clients will tell others how great you are.

You can wait for others to help you grow your business.

Or you can grow it yourself.

Need help with your marketing & communication strategy?

We atjust launched the 2025 Complete Marketing Guide for Financial Advisors‚Äî-

It‚Äôs got easy-to-implement strategies across 5 critical marketing areas:
websites
social media
client and prospect communications
events
video

No overwhelming tactics. Just clear, actionable strategies designed specifically for financial advisors who want to grow their practice without feeling overwhelmed.

Comment ‚ÄúGUIDE‚Äù and I‚Äôll send it to you!

----------

Ô∏èPhoto of me and the kids from our trip hiking the Swiss Alps this summer

Talk about giving your best information away for free - if you want my best advice on how to travel with 3 kids by yourself -and our favorite kid friendly European cities-- let me know - I'll share them in the comments! (I can't promise you won't be exhausted though)
